Lore: Starship maintenance droid. Sold into the service of Jabba. Sympathetic to the droids and aliens it is forced to torture. Hates EV-9D9.
Gametext: May cancel Torture, Aiiii! Aaa! Agggggggggg! or Sonic Bombardment targeting a character at same site. Once during each of your turns, if with any imprisoned captive, may draw destiny: if destiny > 3, randomly select one captive there to be released.
IsPulled: Echo Base Garrison
Cancels: Aiiii! Aaa! Agggggggggg!\par Sonic Bombardment\par Torture

Lore: "As a token of my good will, I present to you a gift: these two droids. Both are hardworking and will serve you well."
Gametext: If you just moved a droid to Audience Chamber, deploy on that droid. Droid is an Undercover spy. Wherever opponent has an alien, opponent's battle destiny draws are -2 and Force drains are -1. Immediate Effect canceled if droid leaves Tatooine. (Immune to Control.)
Information: This Effect can be used on *any* Light Side droid.\par Because Tatooine: Audience Chamber is an interior site, the droid will be protected from cards like Trample or He Hasn't Come Back Yet. Even if Lt. Pol Treidum breaks cover of your undercover spy, A Gift is not canceled.

Lore: Abyssins have an extremely violent culture. They also possess tremendous regenerative abilities. Often become mercenaries once they leave their homeworld, Byss.
Gametext: Power +2 and forfeit +1 while Myo at Audience Chamber. If lost or forfeited during a battle, may use 2 Force to 'regenerate' (place Abyssin in your Used Pile).

Lore: The Abyssins are known for their regenerative abilities. Jabba keeps several statue heads of Abyssin creatures on his repulsorsled.
Gametext: Once per game, target one non-unique character on table. Draw destiny. If destiny < X, retrieve X Force, where X = the number of copies of that card you have on table. (Immune to Sense.) OR Search your Reserve Deck and take a non-unique alien into hand; reshuffle.
Information: Combo Card: Abyssin Ornament & Wounded Wookiee
Pulls: A non-unique alien

Lore: A capture cable is a quick and effective way for bounty hunters to suddenly snare their target.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. We Have A Prisoner and Oo-ta Goo-ta, Solo? play for free and are immune to Sense. If opponent's character is about to be forfeited, your bounty hunter present may capture that character (character is first restored to normal). (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-1)\par When capturing a just forfeited character using this Dark Side Effect, that character is captured after applying forfeit value but before being placed on the Lost Pile. When captured, the character's values that would normally be restored upon leaving table (e.g., forfeit being reduced by 2, power being reduced to 0) has those values reset. In this way, cards deployed on that character (for example, Bounty or a\par weapon) are not placed in the Lost Pile. Additionally, if the card was 'hit', it is no longer 'hit'. This is a specific exception to the just lost ruling.\par This card merely requires that the bounty hunter be present at the location. He need not be present with the forfeited character.

Lore: Male Amanin. Hangs the heads of his victims on his staff. Nicknamed Amanaman; his real name is unknown on Tatooine.
Gametext: Once per battle, may use 2 Force to 'behead' (place out of play) one opposing non-droid character lost or forfeited where present. Adds X to attrition against opponent in battles at same site, where X = the number of 'beheaded' victims.

Lore: Amanin are a primitive hunting species. Exposed to space travel when their planet became a mining world for the Empire. Fierce-tempered when angered.
Gametext: When attacking or being attacked by a creature, power +3 and may add one destiny. If Amanin is alone and causes a non-selective creature to be lost, creature is placed out of play and you may retrieve Force equal to its deploy cost.

Lore: Rapid-fire weapon. Requires three power cells to operate. Has no stun setting.  Lightweight enough to be stored and then quickly mounted when the need arises.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on your transport vehicle. If your warrior aboard here, may target a character or creature using 3 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value. May fire repeatedly for 2 Force each time.

Lore: Aqualish originate from Ando. Continually at war. Reached the stars by eliminating the crew of the first ship that landed on their planet. Often seen on Cloud City.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-10)\par While this system's game text "doubles" a character, it means that:\par - Every printed number on that card is doubled (thus a 1 becomes a 2, a 2 becomes a 4, etc.)\par - Every printed indication of number of uses is doubled (thus "once" becomes "twice," "twice" becomes "four times" etc.). Apply any additional modifiers and other effects to the new values (e.g., a doubled Tonnika Sisters with Mandalorian Armor is power = 6, and a Vul Tazaene that has competed Jedi Test 3 will be ability 4, not ability 6).

Lore: Most space-faring adventurers meet their fate with a calm, quiet dignity.
Gametext: If Boba Fett is defending a battle, draw one destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero). OR Cancel, for remainder of turn, the game text of Jet Pack or any weapon that may fire repeatedly.
Information: This a rather bland card that may find a use against the many bounty hunter decks running around. If people continue to play with their favorite character, Boba Fett, we may see a use for the first part of this destiny 5, Used Interrupt. It allows you to draw destiny and to subtract that number from the opponents power and attrition total if Fett is defending in the battle. The second function simply cancels Jet Pack's game text or any weapon that fires repeatedly. Neither of these are used very often and despite the high destiny on the card, it will probably be too specific to see much time in the field.
Cancels: Game text of Jet Pack.\par Game text of any weapon that may fire repeatedly.\par Game text of Antipersonnel Laser Cannon.\par Game text of AT-ST Dual Cannon.\par Game text of Boba Fett's Blaster Rifle.\par Game text of Dr. Evazan's Sawed-off Blaster.\par Game text of Light Repeating Blaster Rifle.

Lore: Ortolan \b musician\b0  and \b gambler\b0. Head of The Max Rebo Band. Signed a lifetime contract to Jabba in exchange for unlimited food.
Gametext: Power +2 on Hoth. If at same site as another of your musicians, you may play Bith Shuffle to cancel a Force drain at an adjacent site. While at Audience Chamber, all your other musicians are deploy -1 and forfeit +3.
Information: Oddly enough, people may begin to play with Bith Shuffle because of this card alone. Max's ability to cancel a Force drain at a neighboring site can do wonders for saving Force, especially if Max is sitting at a location that your opponent doesn't particularly want to go. Thus, Max usually requires a bodyguard of some kind.
Combo: Max Rebo vs. Walker Garrison - If played correctly, Max can be the centerpiece of a deck which has to play against AT-AT's a lot. With his Power bonus, he becomes a reasonably potent character, and with his Force drain cancelling game text, he can stop at least one of the massive drains pumped out by Walker Garrison.\par \par Max Rebo + Audience Chamber in a Jess-based deck - The musician deck is ready to rock as Max's deploy bonus decreases the already low deploy cost of the musicians, and Jess's text is made more useful.

Lore: Easily obtained by the Rebellion. Many are copies of the BlasTech DL-18 design. Plentiful on Tatooine. Used for suppressive fire.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your alien warrior (free if on Tatooine). May target a character for free. Draw destiny. Target is forfeit -2 for remainder of turn if destiny +2 > defense value.
Information: The Mos Eisley Blaster enhances the Light Side's biggest advantage over the Dark Side in Star Wars, their forfeit values.\par The Dark Side, especially the aliens in Jabba's Palace, has surprisingly low forfeit values, and a savvy Light Side player can quickly exploit that. The Mos Eisley Blaster helps that out tremendously, knocking off two forfeit in one destiny draw. Against powerhouses like Vader and Boba Fett, this is hardly a scratch, but the Dark Side aliens will struggle to have any forfeit at all after being hit with one of these.
IsPulled: Portable Scanner
Combo: Mos Eisley Blaster + A Gift\par Use these two cards together to gain a big advantage in the attrition race. The Dark Side loses two off of its destiny draws, reducing the attrition that you take. Add in the Mos Eisley Blaster, and your opponent takes the same amount of attrition, but that attrition tends to go a little bit farther, by reducing a key character (such as Ortugg or J'Quille) to attrition fodder.

Granted, they don't get quite the bonus that a non-unique Corellian would, they do receive the bonus. So what can you do with this extra power?Well, besides increasing your battle damage, enhanced power increases your resistance to Counter Assault, and makes using weapons like the Bowcaster a lot easier.

Lore: Skrilling \b smuggler\b0. Supplied Jabba's henchmen with weapons when he was Hermi Odle's predecessor. An excellent driver.

Lore: Captured by Jabba. Princess Leia provided a distraction for his henchbeings. Waiting for the first chance to escape. Really made Jabba's tail wiggle.
Gametext: * Deploys free as an escorted captive of Jabba, or a bounty hunter (you may not initiate battle there on same turn). While a captive, opponent's unique (*) aliens at same site are forfeit -2. If released, retrieve 5 Force. Immune to attrition < 3.
Information: Leia Organa personas are:\par \par Boushh\par Daughter Of Skywalker\par Daughter Of Skywalker (V)\par General Leia Organa\par Leia\par Leia (V)\par Leia Organa\par Leia Organa (V)\par Leia With Blaster Rifle\par Leia, Rebel Princess\par Princess Leia\par Princess Leia (V)\par Princess Leia Organa\par Princess Organa\par Prisoner 2187\par -----\par One of the hallmarks of the set, the new Princess Leia is a terrific character, with one extreme drawback, in that you must deploy her as a captive. This is simplified if your opponent helps you out by deploying a bounty hunter or Jabba to a site alone, or near alone. Simply deploy her one turn, hold on to your attack force, and assault the lone hunter another turn. If your opponent is more built up, or playing a Bounty/All Wrapped Up based deck, you'll have to be more crafty, with weapons and destiny-adding interrupts.\par \par Another strategy is to simply leave her as a captive. The reduction in your opponent's forfeit values can be near-devastating, since the Dark Side's aliens are already low in forfeit. Add in some high destinies during battle, and you can wipe out an entire site with surprisingly little effort.
IsPulled: Leia's Back\par Seeking An Audience\par Seeking An Audience (V)
Combo: Princess Leia Organa replacing another Leia\par -----\par Princess Leia Organa (captive) + Luke Skywalker + Anakin's Lightsaber\par -----\par Princess Leia Organa + Jerus Jannick
MatchingWeapon: Anakin's Lightsaber\par Anakin's Lightsaber (V)\par Leia's Blaster Rifle\par Leia's Sporting Blaster
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par This version of the Leia persona enters play either by deploying as a captive or, on rare occasion, by replacing a different Leia using the persona replacement rule (only if that other Leia is a captive of Jabba or a bounty hunter). Leia must still obey all normal deployment rules (e.g., she cannot deploy without presence or Force icons or to an opponent's starship or vehicle). All of this character card's game text should be applied whenever appropriate, even when she's a captive (this is a specific exception to the rules).

Lore: "Greetings, Exalted One. Allow me to introduce myself. I am Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight and friend to Captain Solo." \b Hologram\b0.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Your Force drains are +1 at holosites and opponent must lose an additional 1 Force to draw a card with Shot In The Dark. (Immune to Alter.) OR Deploy on any planet site. Opponent's Force drains are -1 here.

IsPulled: Holoprojector\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)

Lore: Former gas miner. One of the Rebellion's contacts on Cloud City before it was taken over by the Empire. Wishes to return to Bespin and retake the floating city.
Gametext: While on Cloud City, adds 1 to your Force drains at Cloud City sites and adds 4 to destiny of each of your miners drawn for battle destiny. During your deploy phase, may deploy one non-unique Rebel to same Cloud City site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Information: Here is the guy that is basically Echo Base Operations in one character card. He bumps up all of your Force drains on Cloud City while he is there. Also, if you combine the site function with a Clouds deck based around Cloud City, the increased destiny of your miners in battles can be a really big surprise for your opponent.\par \par He can also provide the support you need by getting non-unique Rebels from your Reserve Deck. This allows you to clear all of those low destiny troopers out of your Reserve Deck, and get them on the table. You can quickly amass a pretty formidable fighting force to defend Cloud City. Include couple of Rebel Pilots to help you get a destiny draw, or Rebel Guards for a power boost on defense.
Pulls: One non-unique Rebel to same Cloud City site.\par Corellia Operative\par Dresselian Commando\par Endor Scout Trooper\par Gray Squadron Y-wing Pilot\par Green Squadron Pilot\par Incom Engineer\par Rebel Commander\par Rebel Guard\par Rebel Pilot\par Rebel Scout\par Rebel Squad Leader\par Rebel Tech\par Rebel Trooper\par Rebel Trooper (V)\par Rebel Trooper Recruit\par Rogue Gunner\par Tauntaun Handler\par Tibrin Operative\par Veteran Rogue (V)
IsPulled: Lando Calrissian (V)

Lore: Nicknamed "squidheads." Quarren share their watery homeworld with the Mon Calamari. Betrayed their planet to the Empire. Dwell on the past. Rarely look to the future.
Gametext: If present at a non-shielded site, your Imperials may deploy there (regardless of location deployment restrictions). When at a planet site, Tactical Support, Imperial Reinforcements and Full Scale Alert are Used Interrupts.

Lore: Boba Fett's helmet has infrared capabilities, a motion tracking system, a macrobinocular viewer, an internal comlink and a broadband antenna. He doesn't miss a thing.

CardName: R'kik D'nec, Hero Of The Dune Sea
Lore: A tribe of Tusken Raiders, a herd of angry banthas, a raging Krayt Dragon and R'kik. Minutes later, the Jawa emerged from the Dune Sea, a bantha tusk over his shoulder.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Jawa weapons deploy free on R'kik; when firing one, may add up to 3 to total weapon destiny just drawn. When he is playing Dune Sea Sabacc and wins, he wins double.

Lore: Indigenous to Dathomir, but found on several dozen worlds throughout the galaxy. Vicious predator. Sometimes kept as pets by eccentrics and crime lords.
Gametext: * Ferocity = 8 + destiny. Habitat: Rancor Pit and exterior planet sites. Deploys only to the Rancor Pit or to where Malakili is the only character. Moves towards another Rancor whenever possible.
IsPulled: Swamp

Lore: An 'honest' \b smuggler\b0. Working for Jabba to pay off debts for his ship. Rycar's son. Even more of an idiot.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (or 4 if trained by Rycar Ryjerd). Any starfighter Rayc pilots is immune to Tallon Roll and is not lost if an asteroid sector is drawn for asteroid destiny.
Information: Rayc, as a character, won't make it into many general use decks. He's a little expensive for a power 2, ability 2 character. However, in a space deck, he is near invaluable. Tallon Roll is one of the more effective means for the Dark Side to get rid of pesky starfighters (like the Falcon.) Rayc makes his starfighter immune to this tricky maneuver, protecting you from a world of hurt. Also, against an Asteroids deck, he can be extremely useful, avoiding the nasty Asteroid sector draw. Put him on a high maneuver ship, like an X-Wing on the Falcon, and he'll almost never be hit by a rock. Send him in to the Asteroids on Rycar's Run, which he performs better than any character in the game.
IsPulled: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).
Combo: Rayc Ryjerd + Rycar Ryjerd

Characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b smuggler\b0
Lore: Gran convicted of murder. Exiled from his homeworld. \b Smuggler\b0  and \b bounty hunter\b0. Slowly going insane. Fond of making things explode. Plotting to kill Jabba.
Gametext: Thrice per battle at same site, if you just drew a battle destiny of 3, may use 3 Force to add 3 to that destiny.
IsPulled: Double Back\par Elis in Hinthra\par Murttoc Yine

Lore: Nerf herder. Personally oversees the herding of Jabba's nerfs. Scruffy-looking appearance conceals his expertise in unusual combat techniques.
Gametext: Creatures at same site (except Sarlacc) do not attack and cannot be attacked. Up to three times per turn, may use 1 Force to cumulatively add 1 to his power for remainder of turn.
Information: Since the Hoth expansion came out, people have been wondering about Rennek: would it be a strange new alien, a Jawa or Han Solo's long lost brother? The answer came out with Jabba's Palace, when we learned that Rennek was the king of the sruffy-looking nerf herders. With Power and Ability of only one, the little Rennek seems pretty ordinary, but when you look at his game text, you realize he has the power to change the course of a game. First, he prevents all creatures from attacking at his site (except the almighty Sarlacc, who don't listen to anything but it's stomach), thus protecting you from such nasties as Bubo, the Wampas and especially the roaming Rancors. By keeping Rennek with your small power characters, you can use their game texts longer. The second part of his game text is also interesting: you can raise Rennek's Power three times per turn for only one Force each time! In the mid-game, when you have plenty of Force, Rennek is an argument that your opponent will have to consider. With Who's Scruffy-Looking?, you can double Rennek's Power, thus showing that unusual combat techniques are sometimes the best.
Combo: Rennek + Who's Scruffy-Looking?

Lore: Oola had to choose between giving in to Jabba's constant advances or resisting him and inciting his wrath.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. While you occupy at least 3 battlegrounds or opponent occupies no battlegrounds, you lose no more than 2 Force from each Force drain or 'insert' card. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par See Ultimatum.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par Ultimatum\par The text of this card comes into effect as an automatic action when you lose your second Force (and meet all other requirements of the card). For example, if you are being drained for 5 Force and you satisfy the battleground requirements of Ultimatum as well as having It Could Be Worse in hand and 2 Force saved. If you choose to play It Could Be Worse to reduce the Force loss by 2, you have not lost any Force to the drain, and must still lose 2 Force before Ultimatum will take effect (and you then will not have to lose any more Force).

Lore: "Where am I?" "Jabba's palace." "Who are you?"
Gametext: Place one opponent's Undercover spy in opponent's Used Pile. OR If opponent just deployed a spy to a site where opponent has no presence or Force icons, return spy to hand. Any Force used to deploy spy remains used and that card may not deploy this turn.
Information: Combo Card: Path Of Least Resistance & Revealed

Lore: Male Yarkora. Mysterious member of Jabba's court. Posing as an alien artifact trader. Associates with the B'omarr monks at Jabba's palace. No one knows his true motivations.
Gametext: During battle, if an opponent's alien present, may use 3 Force to peek at top card of any Reserve Deck. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Yarkora are power and forfeit +2.
Combo: Saelt-Marae + Kal'Falnl C'ndros

Lore: Male Kowakian. Prankster. Humiliates others for Jabba's amusement. His life depends on making Jabba laugh at least once per day.
Gametext: Opponent may initiate battle at same site for free. At same or adjacent site, whenever an opponent draws a card for battle destiny, if it is: Even, opponent must use 1 Force (if possible); Odd, destiny card is lost. (AH-hahahahaha!)
IsPulled: Hondo Ohnaka

Lore: Called "Teeth Of The Wind" by Tusken Raiders. Only those familiar with Tatooine's vast deserts can navigate successfully during its furious onslaught.
Gametext: Deploy on a desert. Specify starting direction. All characters (except Jawas and Tusken Raiders) present at same non-interior site are missing. During your control phase, moves to next adjacent site (reversing directions as necessary), but lost if at an interior site.
Information: CubsFan in the PC Rules Questions Forum Mon Aug 21, 2006 9:56 pm\par \par Control may be played as a response to the deployment of Sandwhirl, before it has a chance to resolve. Therefore, you may cancel Sandwhirl before it makes the characters go lost.\par \par This only works, however, if Control is actually declared as a response. If Sandwhirl is successfully deployed, Controlling it later won't help your poor missing characters.\par -----\par Sonn in the PC Rules Questions Forum Tue Aug 22, 2006 12:02 am\par \par Any interrupt that cancels may be played during the optional response portion of the deploying action, and thus cancel it before it ever reaches play. This is why Surreptitious Glance can cancel Dark Deal against TDIGWATT, because the objective doesn't flip until Dark Deal hits the table.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Therefore, you may cancel Sandwhirl before it makes the characters go lost.\par \par This only works, however, if Control is actually declared as a response. If Sandwhirl is successfully deployed, Controlling it later won't help your poor missing characters.\par -----\par Sonn in the PC Rules Questions Forum Tue Aug 22, 2006 12:02 am\par \par Any interrupt that cancels may be played during the optional response portion of the deploying action, and thus cancel it before it ever reaches play. This is why Surreptitious Glance can cancel Dark Deal against TDIGWATT, because the objective doesn't flip until Dark Deal hits the table.

Combo: Sandwhirl + Kitonaks

Lore: A relief in Nal Hutta sandstone. Hand-carved by slaves of the great Hutt artist Dreyba. Commissioned by Jabba to illustrate his vast influence. Titled "Ne Ganna Dateel Jabba."
Gametext: Deploy on Audience Chamber. While all your ability on table is provided only by aliens and [Independent] starship pilots, your aliens and starships deploy -1 and you retrieve 2 Force whenever you initiate battle. (Immune to Alter if you control at least three Jabba's Palace sites.)
Information: Jabba at Jabba's Palace: Audience Chamber makes Scum And Villainy immune to Alter.
IsPulled: Jabba The Hutt (V)\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par You may not receive any of the benefits of this Effect if you do not already have ability on table either provided by an alien or a pilot of an independent starship.
IsCanceledBy: Jabba's Palace: Audience Chamber (Dark Side) Light Side text for 4 Force.\par -----\par Jabba's Palace: Audience Chamber Light Side\par -----\par Force retrieval is canceled by You've Got A Lot Of Guts Coming Here while Han at a battleground.

Lore: Humanoid mercenary. \b Gambler\b0. Blackmailed into working for Jabba. Friend of Yarna d'al' Gargan. Expert in breathing apparatus. Needs Hydron 3 cartridges to breathe.
Gametext: When Doallyn is on Tatooine, Tusken Breath Mask may target one of your characters on Tatooine, is immune to Alter, is not unique, doubles its power and forfeit bonuses and provides protection from Gravel Storm and Sandwhirl.

Combo: Sergeant Doallyn + Sandwhirl

Lore: Ishi Tib accountant. One of Mosep's assistants. Formerly worked for SoroSuub Inc. Blackmailed into working for Jabba. Hates her job. Searching for a means of escape.
Gametext: Power +1 at any swamp. During opponent's control phase, may use 3 Force to examine the cards in opponent's Force Pile, reorder however you wish and replace. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Ishi Tibs are power and forfeit +2.
Information: Swamps are:\par \par Dagobah: Swamp (Light Side)\par Naboo: Swamp\par Swamp\par -----\par This is one expensive lady. For the 3 Force you are paying out, you are only getting an immediate power of 1 and ability of 1. Though she seems vulnerable to weapons fire (low ability number) actually, she does have armor of 3. Like the other Ishi Tibs, Shasa is power +1 at swamps. A rather useless game function currently considering the number of swamps that are played with. What she can do though, is mess with the order of your Force Pile. During your opponents control phase, you can pay 3 Force to sort throuh their Force Pile and rearrange the cards any way you choose. Quirky hun? It may take some time, but I wonder if anyone can find a cool way to use this game text? Finally, she is also a Representative for her race while she is in the Audience Chamber and will add +2 to the power and forfeit of all other Ishis.
Combo: Shasa Tiel + Frozen Assets

Lore: Gifted engineers. Sic-six believe their technology is superior. Have a poison stinger. Spin vast and intricate webs which create a hazard for landing starships. Avoided by pilots.
Gametext: Subtracts 2 from forfeit of each opponent's pilots at same site. Prevents characters from moving to or from same or adjacent site using Elis Helrot or Nabrun Leids.
Information: The Sic-Six embody the aliens in the Star Wars universe. Wierd-looking. However, despite this, the Sic-Six can provide an extremely useful service. Elis Helrot is one of the more effective ways to move characters as the Dark Side, and enough Sic-Six can bring that strategy to a grinding halt. Note, though, that you lose the ability to use Nabrun Leids. However, generally, you'll not be relying on Nabrun Leids, not as much as your opponent will rely on Elis Helrot.
IsPulled: Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

Lore: Repulsorlift engine. 9.2 meters long. Controlled by two directional steering vanes. Jabba's fleet of skiffs is maintained by Barada.
Gametext: Deploy -1 to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 5 passengers. May move as a 'react.' If lost, any characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
Information: Skiffs are:\par \par Racing Skiff\par Skiff\par -----\par This open transport vehicle is one of the better rides available for Light Side and Dark Side characters alike. It deploys -1 to Tatooine sites, Tatooine being one of the fairly popular planets on the tournament scene.\par A Skiff has excellent capacity, easily accommodating one driver and up to five passengers. Remember that the driver need not be a pilot, and doesn't add a piloting bonus to the transport vehicle if he/she is a pilot. However, the driver makes use of his/her personal power along with the passengers since they're all on an open vehicle. Although this makes them vulnerable to weapons fire, any or all the characters on board may surely fire back. \par Dark Side Skiff users may wish to take advantage of an Anti-personnel Laser Cannon deployed on the vehicle as well. The most powerful feature of the Skiff is its ability to move as a react. Being able to move as many as six characters to a battle or Force drain is always advantageous. To protect those characters, they may all disembark should the Skiff become lost, unlike most other vehicles. Taking into account of its attractive features, the Skiff is best utilized with mains and other tough characters to protect multiple exterior sites by reacting to where they're needed. (Just beware of Sense!) Skiffs can play a powerful role in many decks encompassing ground forces by keeping them highly mobile. Mobility is a definite tactical advantage.

Lore: Top speed of 250 kph. Repulsorlift engine. Equipped with two electromagnetic load lifters. Frequently used by shipping companies to transfer cargo between freighters.
Gametext: Deploy -1 to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 5 passengers. May move as a 'react.' If lost, any characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
Information: Skiffs are:\par \par Racing Skiff\par Skiff\par -----\par This open transport vehicle is one of the better rides available for Light Side and Dark Side characters alike. It deploys -1 to Tatooine sites, Tatooine being one of the fairly popular planets on the tournament scene.\par A Skiff has excellent capacity, easily accommodating one driver and up to five passengers. Remember that the driver need not be a pilot, and doesn't add a piloting bonus to the transport vehicle if he/she is a pilot. However, the driver makes use of his/her personal power along with the passengers since they're all on an open vehicle. Although this makes them vulnerable to weapons fire, any or all the characters on board may surely fire back. \par Dark Side Skiff users may wish to take advantage of an Anti-personnel Laser Cannon deployed on the vehicle as well. The most powerful feature of the Skiff is its ability to move as a react. Being able to move as many as six characters to a battle or Force drain is always advantageous. To protect those characters, they may all disembark should the Skiff become lost, unlike most other vehicles. Taking into account of its attractive features, the Skiff is best utilized with mains and other tough characters to protect multiple exterior sites by reacting to where they're needed. (Just beware of Sense!) Skiffs can play a powerful role in many decks encompassing ground forces by keeping them highly mobile. Mobility is a definite tactical advantage.\par \par \par A much more modern version of your transport vehicles. This is a truly a card showing you get what you pay for. For your 3 Force you are getting a 3 power, forfeit, maneuver and landspeed. Not too bad. It will deploy for a -1 on Tatooine and may carry 6 passengers. I can really see this becoming this years exciting new model, while Deserts are on the table.

Lore: Regarded as whiners. Skrillings are a scavenger species. Steal from corpses left behind on battlefields. Feed on carrion and uncooked meat. Avoided by many species.
Gametext: Once per turn, may steal a weapon or device from an opponent's character just lost or forfeited where present. When you play Tusken Scavengers, may steal vehicles, weapons and devices found (place them in your Used Pile).
Combo: Skrilling + Tusken Scavenger

Lore: Bidlo Kwerve was involved in both the procurement and (posthumously) the loss of the rancor.
Gametext: During a battle or attack, place out of play one non-droid character, creature or creature vehicle from your Lost Pile. Add its destiny number to your total power. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take Fallen Portal or Blast the Door, Kid! into hand and reshuffle.
Information: The Skull is a strange card in that it actually forces you to put your own character out of play. In general, this is a bad thing, but it's important to note that the out of play rules don't affect non-unique characters. Also, they don't stop you from putting multiple copies of a unique card out of play. If you can manage to get a high destiny character into your Lost Pile early (like Wedge Antilles or Leesub Sirlin), then you can use their skulls for a massive power boost. Jawas are naturally a destiny of 3, making them very good choices for skull-throwing.
Pulls: Blast The Door, Kid!\par Fallen Portal
Combo: Skull + Fallen Portal -- This combo is obvious, but is very helpful. Fallen Portal is a powerful card, especially if you can lure your opponent into one of the sites mentioned on the card. With the low-ability aliens running around, Fallen Portal can be a surprisingly effective way of taking out your opponent's characters.

Lore: Cadomai is the homeworld of the generally artistic Snivvians. Its cold, dark climate makes them excellent \b scouts\b0.
Gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Power +2 under "nighttime conditions". When at a site, if opponent cancels Nightfall on the related system, causes Effect to go to Used Pile and may retrieve 2 Force.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)\par Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

Gametext: If Han was just lost and Leia is on table (or vice versa), place the just-lost character on your Used Pile instead. OR If Leia is present at a site where Han is a captive, release Han. OR Cancel a Force drain at a prison.
Cancels: A Force drain at a prison

Lore: "Aacccck!"
Gametext: Target an escort alone and its captive. Draw destiny. Escort lost if destiny + captive's power > escort's ability + power. OR During a battle at a site where Leia is an escorted captive, add one battle destiny.
Information: Ah, one of the very rare 7 destiny cards in the game. Typically these cards fall into the "never used except for destiny draws" category but this one may be different. Not only will it give your captive a shot at freedom from a weaker escort, but it will allow you to add one battle destiny whenever Leia is an escorted captive at the same site. This card has actually been used often in conjunction with deploying Leia to Jabba. Drop your captive Leia onto Jabba and then "Aacccck!" no more Jabba. Of course, you need to draw a good destiny to pull it off, but hey use enough Strangles and you got it made!
Combo: Strangle + Princess Leia Organa\par This is an obvious combo that is used quite often. As mentioned above, use this to either destroy Jabba during a critical turn, or to get your Leia out.

Lore: \b Gambler\b0. Lando Calrissian posed as a guard for Jabba in order to \b spy\b0  on the Hutt. Feared that he would be recognized by some of Jabba's companions.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per game, Undercover may deploy on Tamtel from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at a site you control, Rebels are immune to None Shall Pass at that site.
Information: Lando Calrissian personas are:\par \par General Calrissian\par Lando Calrissian\par Lando Calrissian (V)\par Lando Calrissian, Scoundrel\par Lando Calrissian, Unlikely Hero (V)\par [Lando In Millennium Falcon]\par Lando With Blaster Pistol\par Lando With Vibro-Ax\par Tamtel Skreej\par \par Lando Calrissian (Dark Side)\par Lando Calrissian (V) (Dark Side)
Pulls: Undercover
IsPulled: Seeking An Audience\par Seeking An Audience (V)\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).
Combo: Tamtel Skreej + Undercover + Double Agent
Matching: Gold Squadron 1\par Lando's Luxury Yacht (V)\par Millennium Falcon

Lore: Male Elom. Former \b spy\b0  for the Rebellion. Hired by the Alliance to carry messages between Alderaan and the Rebel base on Yavin 4.
Gametext: When at a Yavin 4 site, adds 1 to your Force drains at Alderaan system for each Yavin 4 site you control. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Elom are power and forfeit +1.
Information: Tanus Spijek is a card that allows the Light Side an opportunity to use Alderaan for its own benefit. His text for the +1 Force drain bonus at the Alderaan system for each Yavin 4 site you control is simple to use because there are a decent amount of Light Side Yavin 4 sites, and most are without Dark Side icons, which serves two purposes. This allows the Light player to accumulate Force without supplying the Dark player with much and it keeps most Dark characters away. However, spies should not worry you.
IsPulled: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).
Combo: Tanus Spijek + Double Agent\par -----\par Our Most Desperate Hour + Tatooine System + 3+ Ability Characters\par Since you're already playing the Alderaan system, why not use it to your advantage. Captain Han in the Falcon works well in pulling this one off, plus you can avoid all the nasty stuff down below by remaining in space and on Yavin 4. One of the easiest ways to retrieve Force.\par \par Death Star Docking Bay + Death Star Trash Compactor + Death Star Plans + A Droid\par Fairly simple to pull off since you're playing all the Yavin 4 sites. Simple cards like Tunnel Vision or Hiding In The Garbage will help you get those Death Star sites.\par \par Kessel System + Kessel Run + A Smuggler\par OK, I like to retrieve Force. A Force drain for three may be easier than usual because many Dark players are focused on capturing at sites with Bounty Hunters. Deploy another ship to the Alderaan system where Captain Han is hovering in the Falcon and send him to Kessel.\par \par Effective Repairs + Utinni Effects\par Not only does it cancel the annoying Limited Resources, but this card also allows you to retrieve any Utinni Effect into your hand, which is what all those precious Force retrieval cards just happen to be.\par \par Tanus Spijek doesn't actually play much of a part in the Force retrieval, but after reading his card I came up with all of this. The few card which his game text makes essential for a deck around him is so nicely complimented by the Force retrieval opportunities. This deck has already won a couple times for me and is a lot of fun to play. Your opponent begins to become angry the third or fourth time you've successfully retrieved your entire Lost Pile! If you're still worried about Dark Side spies popping up or other ways for the Dark player to infiltrate Yavin 4, a card like Houjix is excellent in case you get totally taken by surprise and majorly overpowered in a battle, but the deck is character-heavy and those high destinies on the Force retrieval cards will serve you well in firing weapons and battle destinies.

Gametext: Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.   Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
LightSideText: Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
DarkSideText: Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
IsPulled: Imperial Entanglements\par Neimoidian Advisor
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par This non-unique location's game text prevents characters with landspeed less than 2 from moving away; however, it does not affect the movement of vehicles or other kinds of movement such as shuttling, landing and taking off. Characters with landspeed greater than 1 (e.g., Kal'Falnl C'ndros, Boba Fett) can move away from the desert, but the average character needs some kind of assistance. (For example, a vehicle could be deployed to rescue characters trapped in the desert, and some Interrupt cards temporarily add landspeed.)

Gametext: Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.   Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
LightSideText: Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
DarkSideText: Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
Information: The first non-unique site, the Desert increases further the vast wasteland that is the Tatooine Desert. The vast nature of the desert can be used as an effective deterrent for the Dark side if he is attempting to reach Jabba's Palace or Obi-Wan's Hut from Mos Eisley. Also, 2 Deserts make for incredibly slow travel, and can be extremely annoying in conjunction with sites such as the Light Side Jundland Wastes.
IsPulled: Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
Combo: 2 Deserts -- With two of these in hand, you can effectively trap a character at a site. This is especially nasty if you can trap Vader or someone similarly important at a relatively harmless site such as the Dune Sea or the Jawa Camp. They can also help in trapping someone at the Jawa Camp if you have dreams of free Jawas streaming from your hand to defeat the Imperial Army. Just make sure you have a Sandcrawler!
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par This non-unique location's game text prevents characters with landspeed less than 2 from moving away; however, it does not affect the movement of vehicles or other kinds of movement such as shuttling, landing and taking off. Characters with landspeed greater than 1 (e.g., Kal'Falnl C'ndros, Boba Fett) can move away from the desert, but the average character needs some kind of assistance. (For example, a vehicle could be deployed to rescue characters trapped in the desert, and some Interrupt cards temporarily add landspeed.)

Gametext: During your control phase may cause Sarlacc to immediately attack one captive present.
DarkSideText: During your control phase may cause Sarlacc to immediately attack one captive present.
IsPulled: Imperial Entanglements\par Neimoidian Advisor
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par When performing an attack using this site's game text, the Sarlaac may attack any captive present with it (even on board an open vehicle); thus Expand The Empire will not allow it to attack characters at adjacent sites, because they are not present with the Sarlaac.

Gametext: If you occupy with a Jawa, opponent may not draw battle destiny here.   If you occupy with a Tusken Raider, opponent may not draw battle destiny here.
LightSideText: If you occupy with a Jawa, opponent may not draw battle destiny here.
DarkSideText: If you occupy with a Tusken Raider, opponent may not draw battle destiny here.
Information: This site works the best in a Jawa-based deck, but will work effectively in any Tatooine ground deck. Providing a Force drain, plus removing your opponent's battle destiny capability can be rather potent. Watch out for Tusken Raiders, who can cancelyour drawing ability, and Surprise, which can move a Revolution to this site.
IsPulled: A Weakness Can Be Found\par Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan\par Mindful Of The Future\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
Combo: Tatooine: Hutt Canyon + Jawa Camp + 2 Sandcrawlers -- Hordes of free Jawas simply streaming out of your hand as fast as you can draw them. Simply use a Jawa to drive the Sandcrawler over to the Jawa Camp, and wait a turn. Then deploy a Jawa horde, and move them to the Canyon, while the other Sandcrawler moves to the Jawa Camp for another army.

Gametext: If you control, opponent's Jabba's Palace game text here is canceled. Immune to Revolution.   During your deploy phase, may deploy one Jabba's Palace site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
LightSideText: If you control, opponent's Jabba's Palace game text here is canceled. Immune to Revolution.
DarkSideText: During your deploy phase, may deploy one Jabba's Palace site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

Lore: Instigator of several Sand People raids on Tatooine. Keeps the Tusken Raiders well supplied so they can keep local authorities distracted from Jabba's activities.
Gametext: When on Tatooine, may cancel any result of Krayt Dragon Bones. While at Audience Chamber, all your Tusken Raiders are power = 3 and forfeit +2.
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder
Combo: Taym Dren-garen + Krayt Dragon Bones
Cancels: Any result of Krayt Dragon Bones when on Tatooine.

Lore: Quarren accountant. Embezzling from Jabba. \b Leader\b0. Escaped Mon Calamari after its subjugation by the Empire. Plotting to kill Jabba and free the Hutt's captives.
Gametext: Whenever your opponent deploys a character of destiny 1, you may activate 1 Force. While at Audience Chamber, adds 1 to your Force drains where you have a non-unique alien and all your non-unique aliens are deploy -1.
Information: Tessek's game text is very useful in that, over time, he pays for himself. Chances are your opponent is going to play as many as three or four 1-destiny characters. After 3, he's paid for himself, and you begin to bring a profit from his text. His ability to add to Force drains as well as reduce deploy costs can be extremely helpful, especially if you spread out across multiple planets. Most decks aren't prepared to handle a battle on many fronts, unless they use Elis Helrot. With Quite A Mercenary, you can nail quite a few characters. Make sure you have a weapon to fool him into thinking you're saving the Force for something else, though, or have All Wrapped Up on the table.
IsPulled: Princess Organa\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)

Lore: "Jabba! This is your last chance. Free us or die."
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. While you occupy at least 3 battlegrounds or opponent occupies no battlegrounds, you lose no more than 2 Force from each Force drain or 'insert' card. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.\par \par Ultimatum is arguably the most powerful card in the entire expansion. With the ability to force your opponent out into the open, decks can now be more focused on battling, rather than Force draining. The Light Side might be a little bit more prepared for this event, especially in space. With Captain Han and the Falcon, you can be prepared for just about any Dark side assault. On the ground, none match Son Of Skywalker's versatility. With a deck made for fighting, Ultimatum can be the key to bringing your opponent to you, rather than waiting for him.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Combo: Ultimatum in a Teamwork deck -- The ultimate fighting deck gets infinitely better with the addition of this equalizer. Not only can you drop a nasty surprise on your opponent in the form of multiple destiny adding interrupts, but you can weaken his strategy if he does not fall for you ruse. Either way, you have the advantage.\par \par Ultimatum in an Asteroid Sanctuary deck -- Note that neither Resistance nor Ultimatum affect Asteroid Sanctuary in the slightest, giving the Asteroid Sanctuary deck a slight edge over its opponent, who is probably using either Force drain or inserts as a damage dealing strategy. Load up with Tentacles and Controls to stop Alter, and protect the Asteroids. Add Rycar's Run for some Force retrieval.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par The text of this card comes into effect as an automatic action when you lose your second Force (and meet all other requirements of the card). For example, if you are being drained for 5 Force and you satisfy the battleground requirements of Ultimatum as well as having It Could Be Worse in hand and 2 Force saved. If you choose to play It Could Be Worse to reduce the Force loss by 2, you have not lost any Force to the drain, and must still lose 2 Force before Ultimatum will take effect (and you then will not have to lose any more Force).

Lore: "Get the gun! Point it at the deck!"
Gametext: If an AT-AT, an AT-ST, Jabba's Sail Barge or Planet Defender Ion Cannon has just been lost at a site, draw destiny. All cards with that destiny number at that site are lost.

Lore: Kajain'sa'Nikto \b scout\b0. Sold by his family into slavery to Jabba. \b Gambler\b0. Plays sabacc with his fellow Nikto.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. During your control phase, if at a Jabba's Palace site, may use 2 Force to make a 'wager'. Both players draw one destiny. Player with lower number loses 1 Force.

Lore: Assigned by Jabba to work with Hermi Odle. Former technician for the Empire. Developed a method to remotely control seekers. Plotting to kill Jabba.
Gametext: When at a site you control, allows your Seekers to deploy free there. Also allows your Seekers to move for free and to ignore any or all potential target(s) whenever you choose.

Lore: SoroSuub BD-1 Cutter vibro-ax. Powered by an ultrasonic generator concealed in the shaft. Jabba's skiff guards use them to prod victims into the Sarlacc's nest.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any alien warrior. Adds 1 to power. May target a character using 1 Force. Both players draw destiny. Target immediately excluded from battle if warrior's power + your destiny > target's power + opponent's destiny.
IsPulled: Jabba's Through With You\par Mara Jade, The Emperor's Hand\par Snoova

Lore: Vibrating blade powered by an energy cell hidden within the shaft. Used by many moisture farmers to prod banthas and other animals.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any alien warrior. Adds 1 to power. May target a character using 1 Force. Both players draw destiny. Target immediately excluded from battle if warrior's power + your destiny > target's power + opponent's destiny.
Information: The Vibro-Ax seems like a better card for the Dark Side at first. However, the edges that the Light Side has can make it just as deadly for the Light as the Dark. First, the Light Side has the highest power for ability alien in the game, in Chewbacca. Granted, Kitik Keed'kak has a higher power, because of his low ability and low Forfeit, he rarely, if ever makes it into play, especially for his massive deploy cost. Therefore, Chewie can reasonably swing a Vibro-Ax with impunity, with his power boosted marginally by the Ax, and when present with Han, his power becomes 8. Also, the Light Side has considerably better destiny than the Dark, making hitting with the Vibro-Ax even better.
IsPulled: Portable Scanner
Combo: Vibro-Ax + Clash Of Sabers\par Taking your opponent's characters out of battle can be a terrific ability, and this combo can not only take out Vader, but Tarkin as well! Give Chewie a Vibro-Ax, to swing at Tarkin, and have Luke or Obi-Wan Clash Vader.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par The destiny drawn by the player whose character is being targeted by the Vibro-Ax is not a weapon destiny.

Lore: Kajain'sa'Nikto. Keeps Jabba's vehicles and starships well armed. Has hidden several weapon caches on board Jabba's sail barge.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Power +3 when defending a battle. If with your Advosze during your control phase, may search Reserve Deck, take one vehicle weapon into hand and reshuffle. Your vehicle weapons deploy free at same site.
Pulls: One vehicle weapon (when with Advosze).\par AAT Laser Cannon\par Antipersonnel Laser Cannon\par AT-AT Cannon\par AT-ST Dual Cannon\par Double Laser Cannon\par Energy Shell Launchers\par Speeder Bike Cannon\par STAP Blaster Cannons

Lore: Security officer from Kiffex searching for the Tonnika sisters. In love with one of them, he's not sure which.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Twice during battle at same system, may use 2 Force to add 2 to any destiny of 2. If present with Tonnika Sisters, Vul and Tonnika Sisters are lost.
Information: Ok, all of the players who have played longer than a year raise your hands. Ok, all you players who have dealt with the horrific Tonnika Sisters raise your hands. Thought so. Despite the fact that the Tonnika Sisters came from way back when, they are still a headache to all Lightside players to date. Well, now it is the Light players turn. Enter, Vul Tazaenne. This guy is actually pretty good in the navy. As a starship pilot he can not only add 2 to the power of any starship he pilots but, can add 2 to any destiny of 2 for only 2 force, twice per battle. What that means in English is that the you can modify a battle significantly if you so choose. Not bad for a destiny 2 card with 2 ability.
Combo: Vul Tazaenne + Red Leader in Red 1/Gold Leader in Gold 1 + 2 Landing Claws + Kiffex = The coolness of this is it's simplicity. This is not a 6 card combo, but a situation that you can prepare for. You will have the ability to drain for two at Kiffex while keeping a safe distance from your opponent. If they decide to battle you, hide. If you draw any of these cards for destiny, they are all a two's. Also, if you control Kiffex itself with the two starships, Vul will add 4 to all 4's. Not bad for a little 2 deploy character.\par -----\par Vul Tazaene + Kiffex
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par See Kiffex.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-10)\par Kiffex\par While this system's game text "doubles" a character, it means that:\par - Every printed number on that card is doubled (thus a 1 becomes a 2, a 2 becomes a 4, etc.)\par - Every printed indication of number of uses is doubled (thus "once" becomes "twice," "twice" becomes "four times" etc.). Apply any additional modifiers and other effects to the new values (e.g., a doubled Tonnika Sisters with Mandalorian Armor is power = 6, and a Vul Tazaene that has competed Jedi Test 3 will be ability 4, not ability 6).
Cancels: If present with Tonnika Sisters, Vul and Tonnika Sisters are lost.

Lore: A Jedi is taught to use the anger of his opponents (and their weapons) against them.
Gametext: USED: Search your Used Pile, take one weapon into hand and reshuffle. LOST: Cancel You Are Beaten. OR If a battle was just initiated, one of your characters of ability > 3 present may steal one character weapon present.
Information: This is a multi-useful, unique Light Used or Lost Interrupt with a destiny of 4. Its Used function searches through your Used Pile to take one weapon into hand and reshuffle. This can come in handy when looking for that elusive matching weapon that could make a difference in a key battle. One of its Lost functions flat-out cancels the nasty interrupt You Are Beaten, a card that should be canceled when at all possible. Apart from Sense, this is the best way to cancel that Dark interrupt. The final Lost use of Weapon Levitation plays if a battle was just initiated, allowing one of your characters present with ability greater than three to steal one character weapon present. Stealing a troublesome weapon may come in handy from time to time, but all three functions and its attractive destiny number make it a good utility card to include in certain decks.\par \par The Dark Side has enjoyed this fantastic interrupt since Cloud City, and, finally, the Light Side gets its turn. Weapon Levitation can be a great way to swipe an important weapon such as Vader's Lightsaber, without putting yourself in too much of a random situation (like Sabacc.) While Luke cannot use Vader's Lightsaber, he can prevent it from being deployed again. He can also steal other important weapons like Thermal Detonators, Boba Fett's Blaster Rifle, and Dengar's Modified Riot Gun.
Pulls: One weapon from Used Pile.
IsPulled: Yoda's Hope
Combo: Weapon Levitation + Sabacc -- Using these two strategies together, you can completely deprive your opponent of weapons, but there are more subtle parts to this strategy. Sabacc is a great way to manipulate your own Used Pile, so that if you draw Anakin's Lightsaber with Sabacc, you can use Weapon Levitation to get it back out of your Used Pile.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par You may not initiate a Weapon Levitation (Lost function) if the stealing character is incapable of "carrying" a weapon. For example, a B'omarr Monk, or a Disarmed character.

Lore: Weequay are extremely fierce warriors. Species name means, "follower of Quay". Very religious. Communicate through pheromones. Smell really bad.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Deploy -1 to same site as any Weequay. When at same site as any Weequay, (except Weequay Guards), may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder

Lore: To maintain religious practices, Weequay hunters capture banthas. The beasts are then sacrificed as part of a battle ceremony. Tusken Raiders tend not to appreciate this.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. When present at start of battle, may sacrifice (lose) one of your Banthas present; adds 2 to power of each Weequay there for remainder of turn. (May not sacrifice if Tusken Raiders present outnumber Weequay present).
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder

Lore: Patient and quiet. Jabba uses many of his Weequay henchmen as assassins. Use womp rats for target practice during their religious ceremonies.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. May fire one weapon during your control phase (at double use of Force). May use 2 Force to 'assassinate' any character just 'hit' by Weequay Marksman (victim is immediately lost).
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder

Lore: Many of the Weequay at Jabba's palace work for Barada. Enjoy racing their skiffs. Dislike the Nikto guards at Jabba's palace.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Power +2 when defending a battle or when with another Weequay in a battle. Adds 3 to power of any skiff he drives.
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder

Lore: Most of Jabba's guards had been sold to the Hutt and were too scared (or too dumb) to leave. Jabba assigned his best guards to watch over his most prized possessions.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. While you have fewer than 13 cards in your hand, your non-unique cards in hand (except Effects of any kind and Interrupts) are immune to Grimtaash. (Immune to Alter while you occupy 2 battlegrounds).
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Whipids originate from Toola in the Kaelta system, a planet extremely distant from its sun. Accustomed to hunting for prey in the near dark and the bitter cold.
Gametext: Power +2 on Hoth. Forfeit +2 under "nighttime conditions." When at a site, if opponent cancels Sunsdown at the related system, causes Effect to go to Used Pile and may retrieve 2 Force.

Lore: Male Jawa. \b Leader\b0  of a large tribe of Jawas. Plotting with Jabba to take control of a neighboring tribe's territory.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Your Jawa Pack is not unique (*), is doubled, deploys free (or for 6 Force from each player) and \b cumulatively\b0  affects your Jawa's forfeit. While at Audience Chamber or Jawa Camp, all your other Jawas are power +2.
IsPulled: Herat to deploy to same location.

Lore: Kadas'sa'Nikto. One of Jabba's best pilots. Often pilots Jabba's space yacht. \b Smuggler\b0. Prefers to be flying combat starfighters.
Gametext: Deploys only at Tatooine. Power +2 when defending a battle at a Jabba's Palace site. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if piloting an [Independent] starship or if Jabba aboard).
IsPulled: Elis in Hinthra\par Murttoc Yine

Lore: Large, froglike creature often used by Jawas and other Tatooine denizens as guards. Keeps raiding parties and other unwelcomed guests at bay.
Gametext: Habitat: planet sites (except Hoth). Does not attack your characters. When at a Tatooine site, prevents opponent's characters present from using their landspeed.
IsPulled: Swamp

Lore: When blaster fire from the barge's gun hit Chewie's skiff, his leg was injured by shrapnel. This setback distracted the Rebels, causing them to momentarily lose their advantage.
Gametext: During a battle, if opponent just drew more than two battle destiny, cancel all but two of those destiny draws (your choice). OR If your non-unique alien is in a battle, cancel game text of one Rebel present for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Clash Of Sabers.
Information: Combo Card: Abyssin Ornament & Wounded Wookiee

Lore: Mysterious, secretive aliens. Tend to be found as couriers, \b scouts\b0  and t'bac farmers. Some have helped the Alliance's efforts at counter-espionage.
Gametext: If at same site as an Undercover spy during your control phase, may draw destiny. Each of your Yarkoras on table may cumulatively subtract one from that destiny. Spy's "cover is broken" if destiny = spy's ability.
Information: While many of the other characters from Jabba's are there to create hardship for your opponent, this character is purely offensive. The true counter-espionage agent of your characters, Yarkora can infiltrate and destroy them. Adding a number of them together will only make it easy to crack the Undercover and remove those pesky problems.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Might Of The Republic\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)\par Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
Combo: Yarkora + Sorry About the Mess\par Though Yarkora is not a warrior, use Sai'torr Kal Fas or just combine him with another character who can carry a weapon. This will create a team that is sure to beat the spies.

Lore: Female dancer from Askajia. Very protective mother. Makes sure that all those she cares about are well protected.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of the table. While you have fewer than 13 cards in hand, your non-unique cards in hand (except Effects of any kind and Interrupts) are immune to Monnok. (Immune to Alter while you occupy 2 battlegrounds).
Information: This card has one purpose. Protection for a any of the viable non-unique theme decks. The real question is whether to start with it, or try to get it later in the game. Either way, many of the theme decks rely on effects to power them, so including additional copies of The Signal in this deck will probably be rewarded. This allows you to start with Yarna to avoid that first turn Monnok, and deploy your other effects (the Jawa effects for Jawa decks, Haven for a starship deck, Echo Base Operations, etc.) at a time later in the game when you are prepared to capitalize on them.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Kashyyyk: Sacred Forest (V)

CardName: You Will Take Me To Jabba Now
Lore: "Et tu taka bu Jabba now."
Gametext: If Jabba is at a Jabba's Palace site, relocate one of your characters to that location from a related site. OR During your deploy phase, deploy one alien (at normal use of the Force) from Reserve Deck to Audience Chamber; reshuffle.
Pulls: One alien (to Audience Chamber).

Lore: Male Ugnaught. Left Cloud City after the Empire took control. Works for Hermi Odle, helping to supply him with various weaponry. Hopes to someday return to Cloud City.
Gametext: Deploys free to a Cloud City or Jabba's Palace site. Power +2 on Cloud City. During your control phase, may use 3 Force to search your Lost Pile and take one weapon or device into hand.
Information: Overload is a potent card for the Dark side to remove an annoying Lightsaber from time to time. Yoxgit, while not affecting the unfortunate zero drawn for the Overload, can help you get those Lightsabers back into hand, as well as an Electrobinoculars, or any other useful weapon or device. As a character, he is relatively weak for a 2 deploy cost, except on Cloud City. If you have a Light side Cloud City Scenario deck, this character is possibly your best bet for a quick, cheap, powerhouse.
Pulls: One weapon from Lost Pile.\par One device from Lost Pile.
IsPulled: Lando Calrissian (V)

Lore: Native to Endor, Yuzzum compete with Ewoks for food and resources. Possess thick, wooly coats. Hunt in packs. Have a musical language, making them excellent \b musicians\b0.
Gametext: Deploys only on Endor or to same site as a bounty hunter. Power +2 when present with an Ewok. During your control phase, if a bounty hunter or Rodian present, may search Reserve Deck, take one We Have A Prisoner into hand and reshuffle.
Pulls: We Have A Prisoner\par We Have A Prisoner & I Can't Shake Him! (V)
IsPulled: Ak-rev
